title: You know you're a foodie when ...
text:
CNN Leadership
You know you're a foodie when ... By CNN Staff Updated 0922 GMT (1622 HKT) July 20, 2015 JUST WATCHED Chef Massimo Pt 3: Classic dish gets a British twist This story complements the Culinary Journeys TV series, airing monthly on CNN International. See more of the show here: www.cnn.com/journeys . Share photos of your own Culinary Journeys on Instagram with the hashtag #CNNFood for a chance to be featured on CNN. (CNN) Made it your mission to dine at all the Michelin-starred restaurants in Europe? Simply can't resist posting a shot of every single meal you eat on Instagram? We asked CNN readers on our social media accounts to finish the following sentence: "You know you're a foodie when..." Much like the scent of a wheel of Stilton blue cheese, the volume of responses we received was strong. Clearly, you guys are serious about food. Here are 21 signs that you're definitely a foodie, chosen by you. 1. You plan your vacations around meals, not sights A photo posted by The Funnelogy Channel (@thefunnelogychannel) on Jul 13, 2015 at 8:33am PDT "When all your holiday planning is about what the local specialties are and where to get them!" -- marika237, via Instagram U know ur a foodie when u plan ur #travel based on where @Bourdain eats on his shows #CNNFood @CNNTravel #cnntravel "You know you're a foodie when you start planning your travels primarily around food and wine and visits to museums are to take a break between meals." -- Kathy Leiva, via Facebook ‚Äî Joe Cohen (@JoeShmoe820) July 1, 2015 "You know you're a foodie when you quit your job and travel thousands of miles to try a snack..." -- Shankar Sharma, via Facebook @CNNTravel ...you sell all of your possessions to travel the globe to learn about where locals buy food, what they eat, and why. ‚Äî Trena Heinrich (@trenaheinrich) June 30, 2015 "When you're more excited to eat local food than see tourist spots in other countries." -- jammaicatok, via Instagram 2. You firmly believe beautiful food is to be appreciated ... A photo posted by Billy (@ausbilly) on Jul 18, 2015 at 11:30am PDT @CNNTravel you know you're a foodie when your Instagram account looks like a menu #CNNtravel ‚Äî Giselle Martinez (@owemGhEE) June 30, 2015 "You whip out your camera when your food arrives, share it to the world on Instagram, then dive in and later check all the "likes" & comments." -- emkae11, via Instagram 3. ... but you're not afraid of the ugly stuff, either You know you're a foodie when someone tells you not to eat chicken feet because it looks like a hand, yet you do anyway #CNNFood ‚Äî 605Rebecca Kay (@Becky2605) June 30, 2015 "You know you're a foodie when you are willing to eat balut at least once." -- Constance Lastly, via Facebook 4. You know food is the key to a great party @cnni @CNNTravel #CNNFood "you know you're a foodie when...your tailgate is better than most ppls Thanksgiving" üòÄüêîüèàüç¥ pic.twitter.com/OCzXBA8ZdN ‚Äî Gourmet Gents (@Gourmet_Gents) July 3, 2015 5. In fact you'll ditch the party if there's no food "You know you're a foodie when you leave an important state function to address your stomach." -- Rotich Tobias, via Facebook 6. You're so excited to eat you forget to take a photo of your meal A photo posted by Eva Wang (@eatwitheva) on Jul 14, 2015 at 5:14am PDT 7. Food permeates your sleep "You know you're a foodie when you sleepwalk to your patio grill and fire up burgers in a snowstorm at 3 a.m. to satisfy a craving." -- Kerri Blum, via Facebook You know you're a foodie when you sleepwalk into the kitchen at night and reorganize your exotic spices #cnnfood via @CNNTravel ‚Äî Nick Pachelli (@weatheredpasprt) July 1, 2015 "You know you're a foodie when your favorite friend is the refrigerator and you dream about her." -- John Shelnut, via Facebook 8. Not even the miracle of life can curb your appetite "You know you're a foodie when you're ferociously browsing through a gourmet magazine between labor contractions!" -- Ayoosh Muhammed, via Facebook 9. You want your kids to grow up and cook for you "You know you're a foodie when you would rather your one-year-old son go to culinary school in the future rather than attend college." -- Yau-Ru Chen Patz, via Facebook 10. Junk food has lost its luster A photo posted by melcg (@melcgeroleo) on Jul 5, 2015 at 3:51am PDT "You know you're a foodie when you'll find a way to pay extra for something delicious and locally made, vs. something just okay and made in a factory simply because it's cheap."
